genre: Time Travel Thriller / Existential Mystery / Noir Sci-Fi

setting.primary_location: SETI Institute (Mountain View, CA), various underground bunkers, temporal 'echo chambers' where past/present/future overlap
setting.atmosphere: Noir paranoia meets temporal vertigo. Reality has déjà vu quality. Characters question whether they're making choices or following script. Film noir aesthetics - shadows, rain, isolation - but with quantum physics.
setting.technology_level: Near future with quantum computing breakthroughs. Temporal mechanics experimentally proven but not applied. No time machines until protagonist builds one from signal data.

temporal_mechanics.bootstrap_paradox: Information with no origin point - Voyager contains data from future that teaches how to send it back, creating closed causality loop
temporal_mechanics.timeline_types: Multiple failed timelines exist as 'echoes' - protagonist can perceive them as the loop destabilizes
temporal_mechanics.consistency_principle: Timeline fights to maintain consistency - changes cause 'temporal pressure' like wound trying to heal
temporal_mechanics.observer_effect: Protagonist is 'temporally entangled' with Voyager - his observations collapse probability waves across timelines

the_signal_content.layer_1_mathematics: Advanced physics - quantum temporal mechanics humanity hasn't discovered yet
the_signal_content.layer_2_blueprints: Design for quantum device that can interface with past via Voyager as anchor
the_signal_content.layer_3_warning: Encrypted message from dying future humanity - original timeline extinction event
the_signal_content.layer_4_personal: Protagonist's own notes from future iterations of the loop

loop_mechanics.anchor_point: Voyager 2's launch in 1977 - fixed point where signal must be embedded
loop_mechanics.loop_instability: Current loop showing cracks - timeline 'bleeding' causing temporal anomalies
loop_mechanics.final_loop_rule: This is provably the last stable iteration - next loop collapses paradox and erases bootstrapped timeline

alternate_timelines.original_timeline: Voyager destroyed by cosmic debris 2025, humanity never gets interstellar capability, extinction from climate/war ~2150
alternate_timelines.weaponization_timeline: Humanity uses future tech militarily, nuclear war 2034
alternate_timelines.isolation_timeline: Humanity ignores signal, slower decline, extinction ~2200
alternate_timelines.current_timeline: Unknown outcome - protagonist must choose how to close loop

temporal_perception.bleeding_effect: Protagonist increasingly experiences memories from other loops - not hallucinations but actual temporally displaced consciousness
temporal_perception.alternate_self_encounters: Can communicate with past/future versions via quantum device
temporal_perception.determinism_weight: The more protagonist learns from future data, the more constrained his choices become - free will narrows

conspiracy_elements.time_cult: Organization that discovered signal first, believes protagonist is messianic 'Closer of the Loop'
conspiracy_elements.government_hunters: Intelligence agencies want to weaponize temporal technology
conspiracy_elements.corporate_interests: Tech companies willing to kill to monopolize future knowledge
conspiracy_elements.future_agents: Late in trilogy, reveal that some antagonists are from failed future loops trying different solutions

themes: Determinism vs Free Will - If your choices are predetermined by closed time loop, are they still choices?
Burden of Knowledge - Future information as curse not blessing
Identity Across Time - Are you the same person as your temporal echo?
tone: Neo-noir paranoia with existential philosophy. Protagonist is haunted detective figure chasing truth that destroys him. Dialogue is sharp, cynical. Atmosphere of fatalism mixed with desperate hope that choice still matters. Visual motif: mirror reflections and echoes. Temporal confusion rendered clearly - reader always knows 'when' even if protagonist doesn't.
